titles: Reasons most humbly offered to the honourable House of Commons in Parliament, by Sr Robert Sharpeigh, Knight, and Alexander Haitley, Esquire patentees for survey of sea-coales at Newcastle, &c. by nomination of the late Duke of Richmond and Lennox, proving the grant and patent thereof to be necessary and profitable to the common-wealth, the fee to be but competent and proportionable to the charge, and no imposition but a meere wages, or quid pro quo, voluntarily, offered to be payd for the service.
author: Sharpeigh, Robert, Sir.
Haitley, Alexander.
notes: Place and date of publication suggested by STC.
Reproduction of original in: Harvard University. Library.
keywords: Coal mines and mining --  Law and legislation --  England.
